channel.title: tir
channel.description: "Today I Read:" a collection of the little things you read each day. Cherish them!

item.title: Critical Attrition
item.description: A dismal picture of new-book reviews, produced by the individual economics of new-book reviewing.

item.title: The Gay Panopticon: On Remigiusz Ryziński’s “Foucault in Warsaw”
item.description: Review of Ryziński's "Foucault in Warsaw," which may overuse "Madness and Civilization" but mines archives of Poland's antihomosexual surveillance.

item.title: The Tragedy of America's Rural Schools
item.description: Really grim picture of a struggling district in rural Mississippi.

item.title: Ebooks Are an Abomination
item.description: Overdramatic title, sensible critique: good for some reading (linear), bad for otheer reading (random-access, technical, etc.).

item.title: Bertolt Brecht's "Erinnerung an die Marie A."
item.description: Analysis and criticism of a caddish bit of Brecht.

item.title: The Umbrella
item.description: A short story in new translation. Reminds me of "The Match Factory Girl" (Kaurismäki).

item.title: Tove Ditlevsen's Art of Estrangement
item.description: A short Tove Ditlevsen bio, promoting the new translation of The Copenhagen Trilogy.

item.title: David Hockney’s Improbable Inspirations
item.description: Hockney's recent interest in two-point perspective and early Renaissance religious painting.

item.title: The Art of Botox
item.description: Reflections on a morbid Errol Morris-directed Botox ad campaign.

item.title: Read the Damn Error Message
item.description: Handy procedure for reading error traces.
